file_content.text: Uh-huh.
Missing me already, huh.
Look, I like you, you like me, but let's not ruin a good thing with too much talking.
So what's the story, Sith? Seems like you know all about me and I don't know nothing about you.
I honestly can't get a straight read on you.
The Empire enslaved my family, but they decided I was special and made me Sith.
I was a slave.
I killed an Imperial guard, and they rewarded me by making me Sith. The fact that he was electrocuted probably helped.
I was a runaway slave.
Some Imperial thought it would be funny to shoot my kind for sport. I shot back. They wanted to kill me, but made me Sith instead.
I was a convicted criminal.
Funny how those Sith work.
Secrecy is a Sith's best asset.
That's the way I like it.
Then you're a master Sith. Still, I like to know who I'm working with.
That's none of your business.
Leave me alone.
Fair enough. I'll keep my nose where it belongs.
So how is it you became a pirate?
Tell me about you.
I was an accountant on Moneylend when I decided I wanted a little more adventure.
So I put a blaster to the head of the InterGalactic Banking Clan and walked off with a few million credits. Been robbing and murdering ever since.
I don't for one moment believe you were an accountant.
You lie.
Well, how's this for accounting?
How much of that story is true?
I have my doubts.
Does it matter?
In three years, the Sky Princess took more cargo and harassed more Republic ships than half the Imperial fleet.
I'm a liar, and a thief, and a murderer. But I'm good.
Well, it sounds like you made a good start. Just don't put a blaster to my head.
Then I'll watch my back.
Don't worry, Sith. I got a good survival instinct.
Make sure you do.
Good.
I didn't mean to lose my temper. I just don't like prying questions.
I'm sorry.
Didn't mean to pry. Just like to know who I'm working with.
You always a sicko or did you just kind of fall into it, like I did?
Power is wasted if you don't use it, and I'm not squeamish.
I use what I'm given.
We're going to have a lot of fun together, huh?
You always this squeaky clean, or are you making up for something?
I didn't choose the Sith Order. It chose me. I do the best I can.
It's a struggle.
Why bother? What's the universe ever done for you?
What use is fighting the universe? The world would be a better place if we all helped our fellow victims.
I want to do the right thing.
And I say forget them.
It doesn't matter. Why did you become a pirate?
Tell me about you.
I could be a slave, or dead right now. That must count for something.
I've been treated okay.
If you're going to take that grim a view, I guess. Me, I prefer to take what I can while I can.
Hey, uh, can we talk?
Don't tell anyone I said it, but you're alright. I wasn't sure this thing between us was going to work out.
Come on. We're two beautiful, volatile people. What's to doubt?
We're good for each other.
Yeah, we haven't killed each other yet, huh.
Don't tell anyone I said it, but you're alright. You know, I wasn't sure this whole thing was going to work out, traveling with a Sith.
I guess I'll take that as a compliment.
That's nice... right?
That's how I mean it. I got your back.
I knew it would work out.
I wasn't worried.
Yeah? Huh.
I don't know if we'll have kids or anything like that. But if we do, or you have apprentices or whatever, I want to be there to look after them.
I'd be honored.
Thank you.
You never struck me as the nurturing kind.
You surprise me.
You thinking about having kids?
Are you dropping hints?
I could be convinced.
You're like me--you don't take nonsense from anyone.
We have a lot in common.
Got that right.
I guess what I'm trying to say is, I'm in this for the long haul. Partners.
You got kids, you got apprentices, I'll look after them. Maybe teach them a few things they can't do with the Force.
It's good to know you have my back.
I'm glad to have you.
You know I do.
I'm just saying, you're not getting rid of me easy.
So are we getting married or what?
You get right to the point, don't you?
That's blunt.
We've been messing around long enough. No point in being vague.
Do you have a ring?
No ring, no wedding.
As long as you don't ask where I got it.
What girl doesn't dream of the day her lover proposes with a stolen ring? Of course I'll marry you.
You are one of a kind. Yes.
No kidding? Great.
I'm a Sith, you're a pirate. This can never be anything more than what it is.
This will never work.
I didn't think you were the type to get tied down.
You sure about settling down?
Neither are you. Makes us perfect for each other.
Hurry up and marry me before I change my mind.
What are you waiting for?
Just don't turn soft on me.
Stow the sentiment.
Deal.
I know you don't want me turning sentimental, but I have to say it: You're beautiful.
Are you saying you love me?
I love you, too.
Yeah, I guess I am.
You're not so bad yourself.
So are you.
Don't start getting emotional or nothing.
Just shut up and kiss me.
Hush.
Yes, ma'am.
You got one part right: I'm not the settling kind.
Marriage isn't for me.
Is that it? That's all you're going to say?
Guess I should've figured. Worth a shot, though.
Try not to be too disappointed. We can still be together.
I still like you.
Forget it. What was I thinking? Me and a Sith. Stupid.
Your aim was off.
You missed.
Heh. Funny. Talk to you later, huh.
I can't believe you thought I would marry you.
How stupid are you?
Yeah, stupid, huh. Talk to you later.
Hey, uh, Sith. You ever get scared?
The great Andronikos Revel isn't admitting weakness is he?
What's the matter? Afraid?
Not hardly.
When you're running headlong into battlecruiser, you swerve or you shoot. You get scared, you think about it, you die.
Of course. A Sith's strength is emotion. I draw power from my own fear, and that of others.
All the time.
Huh. I never would've expected it.
Been a long time since I've been scared of anything. But when I was closing in on Rike, I thought, what if he gets away from me again?
I'm glad that business is finally done with.
Of what? There is nothing in the galaxy that can touch me.
Never.
Just curious.
I learned a long time ago not to worry about whether the next job will be my last. I'm a dead man, a ghost. Guess it's the same for a Sith.
I've got him! Rike! The SIS agent who betrayed me. He's a dead man!
My old girl, Casey, intercepted an encrypted message. He's moving on Trandosha of all places as we speak. I got to fly or I'll lose him.
Watch yourself. If the Republic's on to you, this could be a trap.
Be careful.
They haven't caught me yet.
You can go, but you have to promise not to kill him.
Enough revenge already!
Since when do you care who I kill? I haven't come this far just to let him get away.
First it was Wilkes on Tatooine, now it's Rike. Eventually you have to let go.
You must move on.
It's either that, or you don't go. And don't try to lie to me. I'll find out.
You don't have a choice.
Fine. I'll consider letting the scumbag live.
Fine, do what you want.
I can't stop you.
It's not as if I can stop you.
Get going.
This the last bit of business tying me to my Republic days. This is the last time I'll run, I promise.
Rike's dead. Was dead before I got to him, lucky jerk.
Turns out I wasn't the only enemy he made, selling secrets. Imperial Intelligence sniper got him. Guess he was playing both sides.
I'm sorry you missed your chance at revenge.
That must be disappointing.
It sounds like he had it coming.
He deserved to die then.
I only wish I could have got an explanation. But I guess he was just rotten all around.
You have to learn to let these things go. Revenge doesn't get you anywhere.
It's better this way.
It gets the anger out. Anyway, Rike's dead. That's good enough for me.
I'm done running off. You and Casey are the only friends I got, and, well, you're the only one with a ship, huh.
I'm not going to start giving out hugs or anything.
Don't get sentimental.
No worries. I'll still shoot a man between the eyes if he looks at me wrong.
Does this mean you're done being a bloodthirsty killer?
Losing your edge?
Nah. But maybe I'm done going after revenge for a bit, huh.
You're not so bad yourself.
I like you, too.
Eh, I just point and shoot. But I'm happy to be along, if you'll have me.
I got an itch that needs scratching. What do you say we take off for a bit, let the ship drift a while in open space?
I could use a break.
Not a bad idea.
Great. Start to feel boxed in after a while.
An intimate moment under the stars?
How romantic.
Something like that. Start to feel boxed in after a while.
Hey, I got an idea. You ever fly to the middle of nothing, cut the engines and just drift?
I don't see why not.
I guess I have time.
I'm always looking for an excuse to waste time.
Sounds fun.
You sure? Won't take long. Just need to get out, get moving. Clears my head, you know?
You just don't take a hint, do you?
I said "no."
Hey, hey. I'm just taking the wrong ones I guess.
Floating idly through space isn't my idea of a good time.
Forget it.
You won't regret it. Promise.
You ever find it funny how, no matter where you are in the galaxy, it always looks like you're at the center of things?
I am at the center of things.
It's not funny. It's true.
Heh. That's right. Sith.
I didn't know you were so philosophical.
You're a deep thinker.
When a pirate gets philosophical, it's just another word for "going crazy."
I think it's beautiful.
I like it.
It's freedom. It's endless possibilities, you know. Any direction you go.
I guess it's that normally I start feeling strangled right now. In a relationship. Like I got to run away.
This morning I woke up and thought, I'm out of here. Then I realized, I didn't want to go.
I'm glad to hear that.
That's a relief.
It's stupid. I know.
You're free to do what you want. Don't worry about me.
You don't have to stay.
Who says this isn't what I want?
If you leave me, I'll kill you.
Don't you dare go.
Heh. You'll have to catch me first.
I love it out here. It's the one place you can really clear your head. Thanks for playing along.
The answer's still "no."
No.
Fair enough. Sorry to bother you.
Hey, uh, Sith, we make a pretty good team.
I was thinking I might take off after I found Rike, but the old job just doesn't sound quite as appealing.
I'd be honored to have you with me.
I'm glad to hear it.
I'm never going to be rid of you, am I?
So I'm stuck with you.
Hey, no need to get snappy about it. If I'm driving you nuts, I'll leave you alone.
I was just playing with you.
It was a joke.
Heh. You really had me going.
You may stay, but don't pretend we're friends.
Remain if you must.
You don't know how long I've been waiting to hear you say those words.
Finally, you speak sense.
You don't have to tell me twice.
You've got all the freedom you need right here.
You may do as you please.
Maybe sometime I'll take you out into open space, show you the thrill of lying in wait for a big freighter and a big payoff.
I may be out of the game, but my skills are sharper than ever.
All right. I said I'd give you an explanation when I got back. Here it is.
We were chasing down a free-trader on a tip in neutral space when an Imperial fleet jumped on our position, blasted us to pieces.
Guy who gave us the tip? An SIS agent--that's spy, to the Empire--named Harman Rike.
So you think Harman Rike set you up.
It was a trap.
Why would a Republic agent tip off an Imperial fleet?
Why would he betray you?
I hear lots of Republic boys were playing both sides. It's not just the Sith who have powers of persuasion.
Could've just been bad intel, except Rike disappeared the same day.
What about the smuggler who played bait?
And the free-trader?
When the Imperial fleet jumped in, he jumped away in the panic. Harman Rike disappeared the same day.
One of my old underworld contacts traced one of his safehouses, but Rike slipped away before I could get to him.
I can understand not wanting to fight somebody else's war. I skipped out myself. But Rike owes me an explanation.
What if the explanation is that he betrayed you and your men and sent you to die?
If your suspicions are right?
He better have a good reason why.
I'm surprised you don't just plan on slitting his throat.
How restrained of you.
I do, but like I said before, I want answers first.
I can see why you would feel betrayed.
I understand your anger.
Look, I don't want to talk about it anymore.
Hey. I gotta run.
Another friend of yours in trouble?
Carl again?
Is the Republic on to you?
What's the problem?
Don't got time for questions.
You're not going anywhere.
No.
You don't give me orders. That was the deal.
Someone from my Republic days has popped up. Someone I thought was dead.
If I don't jump on this tip now, he might disappear again. I'll fill you in later.
I gotta come clean with you, Sith.
I wasn't always the scoundrel you met on Tatooine. I used to run in the Republic military, made captain before I wised up and deserted. Call it misspent youth.
Why are you telling me this now?
Why the confession?
Just as long as your former loyalties don't cloud your vision, we should be okay.
Remember who you serve.
Loyalties? I was just too dumb to know any better.
Sounds like a story I should hear.
You owe me an explanation.
There's not much to tell, which is why I didn't bring it up before.
Carl sent me a message. I guess bailing him out got the Republic military's attention.
Seems they've added "treason" to the charges of desertion and piracy. Guess they're not big on former officers traveling with a Sith.
Anyway, if things get hot, I might need to hop off the radar for a while.
If things get hot, this ship is the safest place for you. The Republic military police are no match for me.
I'll protect you.
You serve on this ship, you stay on this ship.
You will do no such thing.
I'll do what I do. Sometimes you got to just disappear a while, and you don't exactly keep a low profile.
I don't need my best pilot getting thrown in a Republic jail.
Do what you have to do.
Heh. Thanks. Good to know you got my back.
So what's proper manners for asking a Sith Lord out for a drink?
You might try "You want to get a drink?"
Just ask.
All right. You want to get a drink?
Sure, that sounds nice.
That'll do nicely.
You don't. She invites you.
You wait for her to ask.
Well, then. You gonna ask me?
I was thinking we could find a quiet room again.
I'd rather play some more.
Hey, nothing says it won't end up there.
In that case, sure.
You know a good spot? And don't say Mos Ila. That stuff is swill.
I think I know a place....
That wasn't a question.
Quiet room. Now.
Sorry, I don't take orders. Broke that habit.
You want to play rough, I can give as good as I get. But you gotta let me buy you a drink.
All right, but then we're doing what I want to do.
Okay, but then it's my turn.
You think you can beat me at my own game?
You won't win that easily.
You do not speak to a Sith that way.
Watch how you speak to me.
What's the matter? I thought you liked a boy with backbone. Maybe tomorrow, then.
I'm sorry, Andronikos, but we don't have that kind of relationship.
It's not going to happen.
All right. Maybe tomorrow, then.
Want to get a drink with me?
Sure.
Be my pleasure.
You're out of your place.
No. I'm not.
I wasn't out of my place the other night, was I?
Come on. How many times do we get to just relax, show each other off, huh?
In that case, I'd better put on something a little fancier.
Fine, but let me dress up.
I'll wait.
Fine. Just one drink.
Oh, all right.
That a girl.
Can I ask you something? If you could live anywhere, do anything, what would you do?
I have power, my own ship, I can do pretty much whatever I want. Why would I want to do anything else?
I like what I'm doing now.
It's not a bad life, is it?
I always thought the pirate life sounded interesting.
I like your career.
Not as interesting as this. Sure, it's fun when you're pulling in a big freighter, but most of the time you're just hiding, waiting.
I was a slave before I was Sith. I'm only just getting used to the idea that I can do whatever I want.
I don't know.
After I ditched the army, I'd hear someone bark an order and stand to attention. Freedom's hard to get used to.
Used to think all I wanted to do was fly and fly and fly. Didn't matter where.
But I like working with you. Ship's nice, and the company's not bad either.
Granted, I'm no lunk-headed pirate, but I think I deserve better than "not bad."
Not bad?
I'm teasing--hey--who are you calling "lunk-headed"? Crazy Sith.
You're okay, too.
Well, thanks.
Aw, thanks.
Aw, you like me. How sweet.
Don't be sentimental.
Yeah, I guess I do.
Are you kidding? You're the last person I'd want to be seen with.
I'd rather hide you.
It's a little late for that, isn't it?
I understand. I'll wait 'til your mood clears. Maybe tomorrow, then.
What a day, huh?
There's some times you just don't want to get out of bed without a couple adrenals or a good, stiff drink. And then there's times that are just alright.
I never thought of you as an optimist.
You're cheerful.
What's got you in such a good mood?
Is today one of those days?
I just got a good feeling about today, is all.
Got a little shooting practice in, stretched my legs. Just a good feeling.
Don't start getting cheerful, pirate. I need you grumpy and murderous.
I hate perky people.
Heh. Just give me a target. I'll hit it from five kilometers.
So what happened with your friend Carl? Were you able to help him?
Yeah, thanks for asking. Carl's same as ever. Never got a hand he didn't want to play.
His debts weren't anything a few well-placed blaster shots couldn't settle.
Do you ever miss being a pirate?
You sound nostalgic.
I miss some things I guess, but it's not like it's boring around here.
I can't have you running off every time you need to bail out a friend.
Don't do that again.
Don't worry. I told him he's on his own from here out.
I wish I could have helped.
Sounds fun.
You're a pal, but it would've been a waste of your time.
Thanks for letting me bail him out.
Hey, remember I was telling you about Carl Norn, great tech, bad cardplayer? Got me into the pirate racket?
I just got a call from him. He's in deep. The Hutt Cartel on Nar Shaddaa's got his number.
He deserves what he gets, but he's done good by me. I promised I'd meet him on Nar Shaddaa, help him out.
Then you'd better get going.
Go.
What makes you think I'm interested?
Why are you telling me?
I thought it only polite to ask before I flew off. Not that it matters what you say.
I'd be happy to lend a hand if you need it.
Do you want my help?
I appreciate it, but it's nothing I need to drag you into.
I'll try not to be long, huh.
You busy?
I can think of a number of things we could do.
Why? You want to play?
I might've had the same idea.
Why? Did you have something in mind?
Do you have any ideas?
I like you, you like me....
Ancient riddles don't solve themselves.
I'm afraid so.
I think I know something to clear your head.
What say we find a quiet spot on the ship. Get to know each other better.
Let's make the most of it.
If you're thinking what I'm thinking, I can't wait.
I like the sound of that.
Well, let's find out.
I am a Lord of the Sith.
You're out of your place.
And? Have a little fun. Try not to think so much.
This could be worthwhile.
Let's find someplace quiet, then. And dark.
I like how you think.
All right, but you do as I say.
I'm in charge.
We'll see about that.
Have I ever told you how beautiful you are?
You might have mentioned it.
Maybe.
Well, I'm just going to keep saying it.
No, I don't think you have.
Not that I've heard.
Well, you're beautiful.
Don't start getting sentimental on me.
Spare me the mushiness.
Nothing sentimental about liking pretty things. Just means I have a good eye.
Are you still here?
I'm done with you.
Heh. It's like that, huh? Don't let me keep you.
Nevertheless, you are out of your place.
I said "no."
Guess I read you wrong, then. All right. Gotta be something on this hunk of junk that needs fixing.
So what does a Sith do for fun?
Oh, the usual. Lying, killing, manipulating. "Sith" is more of a lifestyle.
Sith things.
At least you have a sense of humor about it, huh.
I haven't exactly had a vacation since I was recruited out of the slave pens.
What's "fun"?
Well maybe you want to hit the tables with me sometime. I think you'd like the rush of a high-stakes game.
That's my secret.
Hey, didn't mean any offense. But I guess that answers my question.
Engine's fixed. Looks like we took on some rock on one of our last jumps. Nothing big.
Reminds me of the time I took the Sky Princess through an asteroid field. My ship mechanics were furious.
Cleaned rock out of our engines for weeks. Had to replace one of the rears, it was so badly damaged.
What were you doing in an asteroid field?
An asteroid field!
Dodging the enforcers.
You brag about it like it wasn't colossally stupid.
How idiotic of you.
You're lucky you made it out alive.
I can't believe you survived.
Heh. Mechanics couldn't take me. Or did you mean the asteroid field? That was nothing.
When you got a fleet of Republic ships on your tail, you take whatever cover you can find. Rocks don't have cannons.
Besides, what's life without a little risk? That's why I became a pirate. The risk, the reward, the freedom.
That's the same reason I became Sith. Though my freedom was perhaps more literal.
I can appreciate that.
Freedom's all in the mind. But it helps to have a good blaster.
Don't let romanticized notions of freedom get to your head. You work for me now.
You're not free anymore.
And I'll do as I please. That's part of the deal. I'm not your servant.
Perhaps I should take up piracy, then. The Sith have too many rules.
Sounds like fun.
I think you'd be one of the best. The galaxy's only Sith pirate.
Y'know, I think I heard the ship's engine making a strange noise earlier. Mind if I check it out sometime?
It doesn't matter to me either way.
I don't care.
I'm sure it's just some debris. But we don't want this thing tanking out on us in a pinch.
I didn't know you knew anything about engines.
You're pretty smart.
I've lived on ships most of my life. You don't do that without picking up something.
Do you think it's a serious problem?
Is it broken?
Won't know until I look. Probably just space dust, but got to be sure.
I'm no expert, but a buddy of mine back before the war taught me most of what I know. Carl Norn. Best technician I knew. Worst cardplayer.
Could never see when the deck was stacked against him, and it always was.
Was this one of your pirate friends?
How did you know him?
My old man ran a shop on one of those planets people only visit if they break down or they're running from something.
Carl stumbled in on a tin can held together by sheer willpower and the skills of the best mechanic in the galaxy.
You have quite the colorful group of friends.
Sounds like a real winner.
Pirate business has all kinds of people.
So what happened to him?
Where is he now?
Beats me. Sure he's alright. Always managed to stay a few light-years ahead of his creditors.
Made me first mate after the war. On a ship called the Bloodshot Rancor. I learned a lot before he gambled the ship away.
But you're sick of hearing me jabber, huh.
Hey, I got a surprise for you. Won it a few years ago in a fight against an Anomid pirate, called himself "the Fear."
Kind of crazy, but a great pilot, great fighter. Blade's just ornamental, but he sure liked to wave it around. Worth a lot of credits from what I hear.
And now you're giving it to me? I'm honored.
Thank you.
A beautiful weapon for a beautiful lady. I know you got a lightsaber, but I figure you need something to pretty up the walls around here.
If I'm not mistaken, I'd say you have a bit of a romantic streak.
I never saw this side of you.
Careful what you say. I got a reputation to protect.
Now you're just flattering me.
Lay off the compliments.
Maybe you deserve it.
I'm sorry I didn't get anything for you.
I wish I had a gift for you.
Haven't you ever heard of giving a girl flowers?
I'd prefer a bouquet.
Sure, but the last florist we passed was closed and besides, they wilt real fast in space.
You know, if you don't take this blade, you might hurt my feelings.
I'm just embarrassed that I didn't get you anything.
I wish I'd got you something.
I don't need anything. Just like looking at you.
You're pretty easy on the eyes yourself.
The feeling's mutual.
Heh. I wouldn't go with me. But I won't talk you out of it.
I don't believe that for one moment.
Hurt your feelings? Unlikely.
You sure? Maybe I like you.
Don't get all sweet on me.
Sentimentality. Yuck.
Don't worry. Got all the "sweet" beat out of me as a kid. Doesn't mean I don't know how to treat a girl right.
Maybe I like you, too.
The feeling's mutual.
Well, then we might just work out after all.
In that case, thank you for the gift.
How sweet.
It's nothing. Can't think of anyone I'd rather give it to.
Forget it. I don't need a stupid sword.
Keep your worthless gift.
Why would I want a stupid sword when I have a lightsaber?
I don't want a useless sword.
The sword's a legend, and I had to go through the fire to get it.
But if you don't want it, I can find another girl who'll take it.
I didn't say I didn't want it.
Don't do that.
That's more like it. Maybe I'll teach you to say "thank you" next.
Watch your tone, pirate. Don't forget I can fry you at any second.
Should I remind you I'm Sith?
Hey, no pulling rank. We agreed.
I warn you. I won't be an easy student.
I dare you to try.
Second I looked at you, I said "she's trouble." You're lucky. I like trouble.
Thank you for the gift.
You don't have to teach me.
Aw, that's sweet. You're welcome. See? Was that so hard?
Find another girl. See if I care.
Go ahead.
I played that game before. You say something like that, you best make sure you won't miss me when I'm gone.
Perhaps I should find a man who gives better gifts.
That road goes both ways.
That's your business, but I don't think you mean it.
I'll just leave this here just in case you change your mind. Do what you want with it.
Need something?
Just checking in on my favorite pirate.
How are you doing?
Hey, I'm flying with the craziest son of a Hutt in the galaxy. No complaints here.
I do have this knot in my back....
A massage would be nice.
There's got to be a Twi'lek you can pay to take care of that, huh? I'm not your slave.
How's the ship flying?
Pilot's report?
Tight. Perfect. No complaints here.
Y'hear that, Sith? Nothing like it in the galaxy. The hum of an idling blaster. Potential energy, right there.
It's like waking up on your birthday, wondering what you got.
For a few minutes, it's anything. The whole galaxy. Just waiting for you to pull the trigger.
What do you call it?
Does it have a name?
Nah, don't name my blasters. It's a bad idea to get attached.
For the strong silent type, you certainly have a way with words.
You talk too much.
If you're going to say something, make it memorable.
You just be careful where you point that thing.
Don't shoot me.
I haven't shot you yet, have I?
Actually, I was wondering--these blasters are nice, but a pirate's only as good as his equipment.
We don't got fancy Force powers like you Sith.
I think I have a spare set here if that's what you're asking for.
Here you go.
I'll pay it back, Sith. Don't worry. Thanks.
If I see a good pair come my way, you'll be the first person I think of.
I'll keep an eye out.
Thanks. Good to know you've got my back.
You know what they say about a poor craftsman....
Stop complaining.
Fair enough. Just remember it when you get in a spot and I miss because of an out-of-whack sensor.
What's wrong with the blasters you have?
Are those not good enough?
Nothing. Yet. Just asking you to keep me in mind.
Won't be much help if my trigger breaks, or the calibration's off.
I was wondering--I appreciate you helping me get my blasters back from Wilkes, but a pirate's only as good as his equipment.
Hey, you got time to chat?
I didn't think you were the chatting kind.
[Flirt] Always.
Odd. You never struck me as one for idle conversation.
I'm surprised you asked.
Sure, did you have something in mind?
Always.
No, just wondering.
I'm a little busy right now.
Not at the moment.
I don't want much time.
Haven't been aboard too long. Like to know who I'm working with. Nothing touchy-feely, just enough to know you got my back.
I like two things: ancient artifacts, and getting my way. Remember that and we'll be fine.
Just don't get in my way.
I'll try to remember.
You get my back, I'll get yours. Simple as that.
Help me and I'll help you.
We see eye to eye.
Good, because if you got all sensitive on me, I might not like you as much.
[Flirt] I like a tough guy.
Last time I cried I was six years old; the old man shot me in the foot to shut me up. Besides, I got a reputation to protect.
Oh, I know. Big, bad pirate has a nasty temper.
Why is that so important?
I hear you've got a temper of your own.
Sure. Make fun. Just wait'll I save your life, huh.
Let me get one thing straight. Are you teasing me or are you into me?
You're a dangerous man. Lucky for you, I like dangerous men.
[Flirt] Good to hear it.
Okay, but you still have to buy me flowers.
[Flirt] Treat me well, okay?
Heh. All right, but let's get one thing straight.
I'm a pirate, you're a Sith. I'm happy as any guy to give a girl what she wants, but I'm not your slave, right? I'm free to go any time.
You're free to do what you want, but I'd prefer if you stayed.
[Flirt] I'd miss you.
Well, you're in luck. Can't think of anywhere I need to go.
I'm afraid Sith don't do equality. You do as I say, or this ends now.
No you're not.
That's it, then. Thanks for being straight with me.
As long as you don't start getting needy. In that case, I'd have to send you away.
[Flirt] Just don't nag.
Needy? You're thinking of some other guy.
Talk to you later, all right.
I give the orders and you take them.
I'm in charge here.
I see how it is. Thanks for explaining.
Just one more thing: You ever butt heads with the Republic, let me have a shot.
I got a score to settle, and it'll be a long time before I call it even.
You know, you got a pretty nice ship. It's no Sky Princess but what is?
I had a ship like it once. No armor to speak of, but you don't need defense when you can maneuver like that.
You didn't seem to have a ship when I met you.
What happened to it?
Got blown to pieces.
Don't get all sentimental on me.
Blah blah blah.
I won't. That ship's space junk now anyway.
You're cute when you reminisce.
[Flirt] I like hearing this.
Well don't expect me to get all nostalgic. That ship's space junk now.
Let's hope we're a little better defended than that.
I don't like being vulnerable.
No doubt. If that ship had had half the armor of this one, I'd still be flying it today.
But it was a thrill while it lasted. Nothing like playing chicken with a ship twice your size and then firing up his tail when he blinks.
The Sky Princess was great, but she couldn't do that.
So why did you move on to the Sky Princess?
Why didn't you replace it?
Nice as a little ship like that is, you can't carry enough cargo, and you burn too much fuel jumping to hyperspace.
A pirate's got to make a living, and he's got to be able to escape when the pressure's on.
But this ship here, best of both worlds. She'll fly like a dream and then she'll jump away.
I'd be glad to have you as a pilot, if you're half as good as you say you are.
You could fly it.
In my line of work, you don't live long exaggerating.
No offense, but I think I'll be doing the flying around here.
You seem like a wild flyer.
Did you really expect a Sith to fly anything less?
I demand the best.
I guess there are two kinds of people: the Sith and everyone else.
I think I'll do the flying from here out.
Stay away from the controls.
What's the matter, Sith? Don't think I got the chops?
Heh, don't worry. I'll look after her like she was my own mother. Not so much as a scratch.
Would you like to fly the ship?
Will you be my pilot?
Heh. How do you Sith say it? "My lord, it would be an honor."
You just tell me where you want to go.
Hey, when you got time, let's head back to the ship. There's something I got to say.
Let me know when you got a minute to talk.
I got nothing to say right now.
Not now.
Sure.
Take a hint.
Anything that don't kill me....
You just tell me where you wanna go.
All right, then. Let's go.
Let's get off this rock.
Let's hope you have a strong stomach, huh.
How about we get outta here while we still can, huh?
Sure thing.
There's the easy way, the hard way and then there's your way....
Aye aye, Captain.
Let's get outta here.
